com.SCHSRobotics.HAL9001.system.source.GUI

Class ScrollingListMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SCHSRobotics.HAL9001.system.source.GUI.Menu
      • com.SCHSRobotics.HAL9001.system.source.GUI.ScrollingListMenu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigDebugMenu, ConfigMenu, ScrollingListTestMenu

    public abstract class ScrollingListMenu
extends Menu
    An abstract class extending Menu.java that represents a common typ of menu.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0 Creation Date: 7/20/19
    Author:
    Dylan Zueck, Crow Force

        protected int menuNumber

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScrollingListMenu

        public ScrollingListMenu(GUI gui,
                         Cursor cursor,
                         java.util.ArrayList<GuiLine> startingLines,
                         int selectionZoneWidth,
                         int selectionZoneHeight)
        Constructor for ScrollingListMenu class.
        Parameters:
        gui - The GUI that will be used to render the menu.
        cursor - The cursor assigned to this menu.
        startingLines - The list of lines that will be displayed when the menu is first rendered.
        selectionZoneWidth - The maximum x value that the cursor will be able to travel to inside the selection zone. Note: This is not the actual width of the zone itself, but a boundary for the index.
        selectionZoneHeight - The maximum y value that the cursor will be able to travel to inside the selection zone. Note: This is not the actual height of the zone itself, but a boundary for the index.

      • ScrollingListMenu

        public ScrollingListMenu(GUI gui,
                         Cursor cursor,
                         GuiLine[] startingLines,
                         int selectionZoneWidth,
                         int selectionZoneHeight)
        Constructor for ScrollingListMenu class.
        Parameters:
        gui - The GUI that will be used to render the menu.
        cursor - The cursor assigned to this menu.
        startingLines - The list of lines that will be displayed when the menu is first rendered.
        selectionZoneWidth - The maximum x value that the cursor will be able to travel to inside the selection zone. Note: This is not the actual width of the zone itself, but a boundary for the index.
        selectionZoneHeight - The maximum y value that the cursor will be able to travel to inside the selection zone. Note: This is not the actual height of the zone itself, but a boundary for the index.
